post_text: The United States Army 10th Combat Aviation Brigade, 10th Mountain Division recently flew American flags 🇺🇸 🇺🇸 across Afghanistan onboard its helicopters 🚁 to honor the Class of 2020. On June 22, a flag was presented to General Brown Junior-Senior High School Principal Nicole Donaldson in recognition of the dedication and academic achievements of the General Brown Central School District Class of 2020. 👇👇The flag was flown May 10 on a USH-60M Army Blackhawk helicopter, tail number 92-26446, in Afghanistan during combat operations in support of Operation Freedom’s Sentinel. It also flew in front of the 10th Combat Aviation Brigade, 10th Mountain Division headquarters at Bagram Airfield on May 11. Thank you, 10th Combat Aviation Brigade, 10th Mountain Division and U.S. Army Fort Drum & 10th Mountain Division, for all you do to protect and ensure our freedoms! 💞 🇺🇸 #Classof2020 🦁 💛

Haven’t mailed your absentee ballot yet for the school budget vote and school board election? Gov. Andrew Cuomo issued an Executive Order extending the deadline for school districts to receive school budget ballots by mail to 5 p.m. June 16. Voters in the General Brown Central School District may return their ballots by mail by using the pre-paid return envelope that was sent with their ballot, or they may drop off the ballot in its sealed, signed envelope in the locked drop box outside the district office 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. on Tuesday, June 9. Hand-delivered ballots will not be accepted after 5 p.m. June 9, per the governor’s Executive Order.
For information about the 2020-21 budget proposal, school board candidates and other propositions that will be on the ballot, go to the district website’s Business page, which also has more information on the absentee ballot voting process.
https://www.gblions.org/domain/42

post_text: Have you filled out your 2020 Census yet? post_text: Did you hear what the 30 members of the varsity football team did to commemorate the 9/11 anniversary? To honor all those who gave their time, energy and lives on that day and in the months after, General Brown team members conducted a stair climb Wednesday after school at Fisher Field. While the fire calls from 9/11 played on the speakers, the student-athletes carried fire hoses over their shoulders just as the firefighters in the Twin Towers did. Each player also researched a firefighter who died in the towers and then taught the rest of the team what they learned. Thank you to the Brownville, Dexter and Fort Drum firefighters who came and spoke to the team to help them understand, appreciate and remember the sacrifices that were made by so many on 9/11. 💛 💛

post_text: The FIRST LEGO League Jr. (FLLJr) is a fun STEM program. STEM stands for science, technology, engineering, and math. The team learned about the "Challenge" in October and then designed and built a Team Model to show what they leaned. These determined students stayed after school several days a month in order to complete the challenge. The students had to code and program at least one motorized part of their model. In connection with Clarkson University, they participated in an exhibition on Saturday, March 30th at Calcium Primary School. The team had a fun and exciting morning! The students worked hard to solve the challenge and build a worthy structure! The students had a table to display their "solution" and poster. Two Clarkson students interviewed the students about their project. After all the interviews, every student received a medal and a certificate. We also received a small trophy to display.
